clauses.title: Federal Motor Carrier Safety — Commercial Nexus (Interstate)
clauses.constitutional_anchor: U.S. Const. art. I, §8, cl.3 (Commerce Clause)
clauses.intent: Safety regulation of commercial motor carriers in interstate (and certain intrastate) commerce.
scope_notes: FMCSA authority attaches to commerce (for-hire carriage / business use), not private, non-commercial travel.
States may diverge for intrastate carriers, but must retain the commercial nexus.

clauses.title: 49 CFR §40.13(h) — DOT Testing Applies Only to Safety-Sensitive Employees
clauses.constitutional_anchor: U.S. Const. art. I, §8, cl.3; due process & equal protection (5th/14th)
clauses.intent: Alcohol/drug testing regime is limited to DOT-regulated, safety-sensitive roles — not the general public.
scope_notes: Implied-consent constructs cannot expand DOT testing to non-DOT citizens absent lawful nexus.

clauses.title: FHWA–FMCSA 2025 Memo — Truck Parking Eligibility (Titles 23 & 49)
clauses.constitutional_anchor: U.S. Const. art. I, §8, cl.3 (Commerce / freight system)
clauses.intent: Clarifies federal funds eligibility for truck parking within freight/logistics (commercial) scope.
scope_notes: State Freight Plans must assess commercial-vehicle parking; scope remains freight-centric.
Confirms the policy intent is commercial operators, not private motorists.
